meanings.definition: Growing out unnaturally or as a superfluous part.
meanings.sent1: The excrescent growth on the tree looked strange and out of place.
meanings.sent2: The excrescent branch on the plant seemed unnecessary and odd.
meanings.sent3: The excrescent flower on the cactus made it look like it was wearing a tiny hat.
meanings.sent4: The excrescent ideas in his mind bloomed into wild fantasies.
meanings.sent5: The excrescent tumor on the dog's leg was impossible to ignore.

meanings.sent1: The excrescent on the rock surface provided a foothold for the climbers.
meanings.sent2: The excrescent of the tree trunk was a perfect spot for birds to perch.
meanings.sent3: The excrescent on the pumpkin made it look like it had a tiny arm waving.
meanings.sent4: The excrescent of creativity in her mind led to a burst of new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The excrescent on the building's facade gave it a unique architectural feature.
